channel.title: daniel-e blog
channel.description: Notes on machine learning, my activities on GitHub and more

item.title: Averaging MNIST handwritten digits with Octave
item.description: In this post we will see how the average digit of the MNIST database of handwritten digits looks like. The MNIST database of handwritten digits (see here) is a very popular dataset used by the machine learning research community for testing the performance of learning algorithms for the task of...

item.title: k-Nearest Neighbors on MNIST digits with Octave
MNIST database of handwritten digits for Octave
item.description: In this post you will see how to convert the MNIST database of handwritten digits via rustml into a format that can be read with Octave. The MNIST database of handwritten digits (see here) is a very popular dataset used by the machine learning research community for testing the performance...

item.title: Permission denied for lsof in Docker
item.description: On my host system I have installed Linux Mint 17 and on that host I’m running Docker with Ubuntu 14.10. Recently I wanted to call lsof in a Docker container and I got the following permission denied error: root@ada77fe6ef60:/tmp $ lsof -p 751 COMMAND PID USER FD TYPE DEVICE SIZE/OFF...

item.title: Octave performance - Ubuntu 14.10 vs Linux Mint 17 Qiana
item.description: Recently I played around with Octave that I’ve installed on Ubuntu 14.10 running in a Docker container. The host system on which Docker is running is a Linux Mint 17 (Qiana). I was wondering whether there is a significant overhead induced by Docker when doing big matrix multiplications. So, I’ve...
